sentence.Network_en: Sepulchrals are sacred undead and wield magical obsidian glaives.
sentence.Network_cn: 丧葬者是神圣的亡灵生物,挥舞带有魔力的黑耀石砍刀.

sentence.Network_en: In addition, obsidian is sacred to the Maoris.
sentence.Network_cn: 此外, 黑曜石是神圣的毛利人之物.

sentence.Network_en: Once you have enough obsidian, activate the idols.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦你有足够的黑曜石, 激活神像.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin obsidianus, error for obsianus, from Obsius, the name (in Pliny) of the discoverer of a similar stone

means.word_mean: 1. acid or granitic glass; usually dark, but transparent in thin pieces
